document.masterDocTitle: Detailed distribution of Cassida sanguinosa and C. leucanthemi (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cassidinae: Cassidini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Detailed distribution of Cassida sanguinosa and C. leucanthemi (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cassidinae: Cassidini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cassida leucanthemi Bordy, 1995a: 377
.
Cassida sanguinosa
ab. viridissima
Reitter, 1912: 217
, syn. nov.
Cassida ( Cassida ) sanguinosa
ab. viridissima :
SPAETH & REITTER (1926) : 47
(as syn. of
C. languida
).

Bionomics. Host plants. Asteraceae :
Leucanthemum vulgare
,
Carduus argemose ssp. obtusisquamosus
; Caryophyllaceae :
Silene nutans
( BORDY 1995a , 2000 ), the latter two host plants being doubtful. I observed larvae and adults on
Leucanthemum ircutianum
(new host plant) in Romania in 2005.

Comments. REITTER (1912) described the aberration viridissima of
C. sanguinosa
with black bases of the femora. During my stay in HNHM I found one specimen (labelled ‘Germ[ania].’) and identified by Reitter as
C. sanguinosa
ab. viridissima . This specimen, with great probability representing a type of ab. viridissima , actually belongs to
C. leucanthemi
. This aberration has never been raised to higher rank and thus is an unavailable name, here synonymized with
C. leucanthemi
.

Material examined. HUNGARY :
ZEMPLÉN, Pálháza, Istvánkút, 6.-11.vi.1955 , 1 spec. , Kaszab & Székessy lgt. ( HNHM ).

Comments. This specimen has intermediate characters combining both species together (shallowly emarginate labrum, completely yellow legs, body somewhat elongate but not parallelsided) and badly preserved colouration of dorsum (probably caused by killing substance).
